channel.title: Learning to code Axoloti Objects
channel.description:
Resources that can be useful for learning to code axoloti objects:
##Pre-requisites - good understanding of Axoloti! - basic C experience, some C++ is useful later - some DSP coding experience/knowledge - xml (optional/useful) - reasonable level of maths (useful, depending upon what you want to do)
as you can see, to create objects... you need a knowledge of a few things, so first thing its be reasonable in your expectations, a novice programmer/dsp coder is not going to be programming filters/reverbs any time soon.... but there are lots of other things you can 'cut your teeth on'
(note: this is a wiki post so users can edit, and update with useful resources)
## Resources Axoloti resources
* here ... start with user guide * links to useful threads?
C Programming resources
* K & R C book (bible :) ) * tons on the internet.. good references? * stackoverflow.com
[Bit twiddling hacks](https://graphics.stanford.edu/~seander/bithacks.html)
DSP resources
* [dspguide.com]() * [kvraudio forum - dsp programming section](https://www.kvraudio.com/forum/viewforum.php?f=33) * [music-dsp](http://music.columbia.edu/cmc/music-dsp/) mailing list * [dsprelated.com](https://www.dsprelated.com/) - All You Can Eat DSP (check out the Free Books section) * [Julius Orion Smith III Home Page](https://ccrma.stanford.edu/~jos/) * [Mathematics of the Discrete Fourier Transform](https://ccrma.stanford.edu/~jos/mdft/) * [Introduction to Digital Filters](https://ccrma.stanford.edu/~jos/filters/) * [Physical Audio Signal Processing](https://ccrma.stanford.edu/~jos/pasp/) * [Spectral Audio Signal Processing](https://ccrma.stanford.edu/~jos/sasp/) * A good overview of oscillators: [Digital Sound Generation](https://www.zhdk.ch/fileadmin/data_subsites/data_icst/Downloads/Digital_Sound/Digital_Sound_Generation_1.pdf) * [DAFX](http://dafx.de/) conference proceedings and [book](http://eu.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0470665998.html) * [Digital Audio Signal Processing](http://eu.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0470997850.html) book * [Digital Signal Processing Using the ARM Cortex M4](http://eu.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-1118859049.html) book
XML resources - lots on internet, and you only need basics
Maths resources - ???

item.title: Learning to code Axoloti Objects
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

I just started on this c++ free online course. From what I can see by now it covers some of the basics like variables and so on which are used in Axoloti. Just what I need to understand the lingo in here a little bit better And I thought I would share it here if anyone else would like to take the first steps into coding Axoloti objects.

https://www.sololearn.com/Courses/

This is a screenshot of the first modules. These are all free and there is in all 80 free modules. Very easy to navigate and with "hands on" examples:

c.png702x510 36.3 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Learning to code Axoloti Objects
item.dc:creator: @philoop
item.description:
@philoop wrote:

Found this http://infocenter.arm.com/help/index.jsp?topic=/com.arm.doc.dui0553a/BABFADHJ.html
Arm Processor commands like SSAT and SMMUL commands explained.
and
http://www2.st.com/content/st_com/en/products/microcontrollers/stm32-32-bit-arm-cortex-mcus/stm32f4-series/stm32f427-437.html

Read full topic

item.title: Learning to code Axoloti Objects
item.dc:creator: @Quincas Quincas Moreira
item.description:
@Quincas wrote:

Awesome! I'll be watching this section closely, asking quedtions and sharing discoveries. Thanks @thetechnobear!

Read full topic

item.title: Learning to code Axoloti Objects
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Resources that can be useful for learning to code axoloti objects:

Pre-requisites

  • good understanding of Axoloti!
  • basic C experience, some C++ is useful later
  • some DSP coding experience/knowledge
  • xml (optional/useful)
  • reasonable level of maths (useful, depending upon what you want to do)

as you can see, to create objects... you need a knowledge of a few things,
so first thing its be reasonable in your expectations, a novice programmer/dsp coder is not going to be programming filters/reverbs any time soon.... but there are lots of other things you can 'cut your teeth on'

(note: this is a wiki post so users can edit, and update with useful resources)

Resources

Axoloti resources

  • here ... start with user guide
  • links to useful threads?

C Programming resources

  • K & R C book (bible )
  • tons on the internet.. good references?
  • stackoverflow.com

Bit twiddling hacks

DSP resources

  • dspguide.com
  • kvraudio forum - dsp programming section
  • music-dsp mailing list
  • dsprelated.com - All You Can Eat DSP (check out the Free Books section)
  • Julius Orion Smith III Home Page
    • Mathematics of the Discrete Fourier Transform
    • Introduction to Digital Filters
    • Physical Audio Signal Processing
    • Spectral Audio Signal Processing
  • A good overview of oscillators: Digital Sound Generation
  • DAFX conference proceedings and book
  • Digital Audio Signal Processing book
  • Digital Signal Processing Using the ARM Cortex M4 book

XML resources
- lots on internet, and you only need basics

Maths resources
- ???

Read full topic
